title: Product Manager, High Performance Operations
content:
Who we are
About Stripe
Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies—from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups—use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone’s reach while doing the most important work of your career.
About the team
Executing operationally is an unheralded superpower for Stripe as a financial technology company. Businesses that run on Stripe - from fledgling upstarts to household names - place significant trust in Stripe to be a reliable, compliant and safe financial platform. 
Underpinning Stripe’s world-class platform are a wide variety of operational processes that are critical to delivering a great customer experience, maintaining regulatory compliance, minimizing risk and meeting legal obligations. The High Performance Operations team is a newly formed team chartered to uplevel all operational work at Stripe to be executed effectively, efficiently and at a consistently high level of quality.
What you’ll do
As the Product Manager of the High Performance Operations (HPO) team in Romania, you’ll be responsible for defining and building the technology platform that will enable every team at Stripe to execute those operational processes with the same level of rigor, effectiveness and efficiency as Stripe’s largest operational teams. 
Day to day you’ll be working closely with a local team of engineers as well as operational process experts from the Operations organization. You’ll collaborate with peers in the Support Experience, Capital for Platforms, Risk Experience and many others to craft the vision for the future of operational tooling at Stripe. 
Responsibilities

Develop a deep understanding of the operator persona at Stripe. 
Become an expert in the landscape of operational work at Stripe across a diverse set of products and business areas, e.g. Capital for Platforms, Risk,  Financial Crimes, Legal, People etc. 
Partner closely with Stripe’s existing Operations teams, including Workforce Management, Strategy & Analytics, Operations Technology, and more. 
Build the vision and define the strategy for High Performance Operations at Stripe 
Help to craft a strong, independent team culture with your engineering colleagues
Have a profound impact on the trajectory of the Stripe business by unlocking operational scale.

Who you are
Our ideal Product Manager will be entrepreneurial, user-focused, comfortable in ambiguity, and willing to jump into a messy problem space and create order. Ideally you’ve worked with operational teams in the past and have a sense of what great looks like.
Minimum requirements

6+ years of relevant product management experience with a track record of delivering excellent results
Experience managing technical software products from kick-off to ship
Strong stakeholder management skills - including the ability to influence stakeholders across organizations and borders
Strong communications skills - you can summarize and express complex requirements in an accessible and precise manner
Ability to navigate ambiguous situations, gather data, build intuition and develop strategy.

Preferred qualifications

Computer Science background or equivalent technical experience
Experience working with operational teams.

questions.label: Please select the country where you currently reside.
Please select the country or countries you anticipate working in for the role in which you are applying.
Are you authorized to work in the location(s) you selected in your previous response?
Will you require Stripe to sponsor you for a work permit now or in the future for the location(s) you selected in in your previous response?

questions.description: Stripe is currently operating in a hybrid work environment. In-office expectations for office-assigned Stripes vary by team. A remote location, in most cases, is defined as living 50 miles or more from an office location. While you would be welcome to join the office for team or business meetings when necessary, the expectation would be that you would regularly work from home rather than a Stripe office location. Stripe offices are located in Amsterdam, Bangkok, Bengaluru, Berlin, Chicago, Dubai, Dublin, Jakarta, London, Madrid, Mexico City, New York City, Paris, São Paulo, Singapore, South San Francisco, Seattle, Tokyo, and Toronto. Stripe does not cover the cost of relocating to a remote location. We encourage you to apply for roles that match the location in which you live or have intentions to live.
questions.label: If this role offers the option to work from a remote location, do you plan to work remotely?

values.label: Yes, I intend to work remotely.
No, I intend to work from an office location.
